node.title: Covid-19: Businesses get more detail on operating under traffic light system
node.description: The Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment has this morning released guidance for businesses on how operate under the traffic light system.

node.title: How one Native American tribe is working to restore Montana's buffalo population
node.description: The Blackfeet Nation is working to change buffalo numbers in the rolling hills of Montana.

node.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Says Kevin McCarthy Doesn't Have 'Full Support to be Speaker'
node.description: "Many of us that are very unhappy about the failure to hold Republicans accountable, while conservatives like me ... and many others just constantly take the abuse by the Democrats," Greene said.

node.title: Man charged over attack on bystander who intervened in domestic violence assault
node.description: Police have charged a man, and are searching for another, allegedly involved in an assault on a good Samaritan who tried to stop an attack on a woman.

node.title: Google to call comedian FriendlyJordies as witness in Barilaro defamation case
node.description: Google will call YouTube comedian FriendlyJordies as a witness in a defamation case brought by former deputy premier John Barilaro.

node.title: Queensland's latest COVID scares 'closed' as Minister apologises for border rules confusion
node.description: It's been 14 days since the latest COVID scares in Queensland, prompting officials to say the threat of wider outbreaks on the Gold Coast and Goondiwindi is over.

node.title: Taken by the cleaners: ANZ's home loan 'introducer' scheme lands it in court
node.description: Big four bank ANZ will face court over a scheme where unqualified people pushed home loan customers towards the bank and got a commission for it.

node.title: Rain pummels east coast of Australia, swelling rivers, wiping out crops
node.description: Rain has continued to fall overnight, leaving towns and highways flooded but also bringing hope and joy to parts of far-west New South Wales.

node.title: Tax changes causing confusion for property investors
node.description: Investors are going off the residential property market amid confusion about ongoing tax changes.

node.title: France expands sea monitoring as migrants vow to pursue UK dream
node.description: France pledged to step up surveillance of its northern shores, but migrants huddling in makeshift camps say nothing will stop them from trying to cross the Channel to Britain.

node.title: 'Just fabulous': Work begins on $80m theatre in Hamilton
node.description: After five years in the planning, work has started on an $80m performing arts theatre in central Hamilton.

node.title: Covid-19: Police and Defence Force will be required to be vaccinated
node.description: NZ police and Defence Force workers will be required to be vaccinated as part of the Covid-19 traffic light system.

node.title: New options to get My Vaccine Pass as demand high
node.description: Some pharmacies will now be able to help people get their vaccine pass.

node.title: Walmart tests out drone delivery service in Arkansas
node.description: Shoppers living near Walmart's headquarters in Arkansas can not get packages delivered via drone.

node.title: Rare 'double diamond' discovery comes as race to restart mothballed Ellendale mine heats up
node.description: Mining veteran Peter McNally couldn't believe his eyes when his company unearthed an extremely rare 'double diamond' in the Kimberley's famous Ellendale province, famous for its exquisite fancy yellow diamonds.

node.title: Dozens killed in one of Russia's worst coal mine disasters since Soviet era
node.description: An accident in a Siberian coal mine kills more than 50 people, including six rescuers, in one of Russia's worst mining disasters since Soviet times.

node.title: Concerns raised about KiwiRail's planned 177ha Palmerston North yard expansion
node.description: KiwiRail has outgrown its decades-old rail yard in Palmerston North and plans to transform 177 hectares of land to the north of the city into a 24-7 operation designed to accommodate trains up to 1.5…

node.title: Rain pummels east coast, swelling rivers, wiping out crops
node.description: Hopes of a bumper harvest are dashed in parts of New South Wales as rain continues, flooding towns and leaving farmers feeling anxious.

node.title: New COVID-19 variant described as 'worst one yet' emerges in South Africa
node.description: Britain bans travellers from six countries as scientists identify a new coronavirus variant they say has mutations likely make it more infectious and resistant to vaccines.

node.title: Tim Paine takes leave of absence 'for the foreseeable future'
node.description: The former test captain has decided to take a break from all forms of cricket and will not be available for the upcoming Ashes, following discussions over the past day with Cricket Tasmania.

node.title: 2degrees and Orcon Group merger talks may have hit a wall - media report
node.description: Merger talks between telecommunications company 2degrees and local broadband operator Orcon Group may have hit a wall, according to an Australian media report.

node.title: Portugal reimposes Covid-19 restrictions as cases rise
node.description: Portugal, where about 87 percent of the population is fully inoculated against Covid-19, announced it would reimpose some restrictions to stop a surge in cases.

node.title: Covid-19: Rapid antigen tests 'not going to pick everyone up' - researcher
node.description: Rapid antigen tests can miss up to 44 percent of positive Covid-19 cases, according to a new study out in the New Zealand Medical Journal. Audio

node.title: Expert says chronic fatigue sufferers should be exempt from Covid-19 vaccination
node.description: One of the country's leading biomedical scientists has written to the prime minister and director-general of health urging vaccination exemptions for chronic fatigue syndrome sufferers.

node.title: Police looking for dashcam footage in homicide investigation
node.description: Police are seeking dashcam footage that may help their investigation into a West Auckland homicide.

node.title: Proposed RMA change sees online bidding on houses drive prices further - auctioneer
node.description: Auckland's housing market continues to soar despite the city spending more than 100 days in lockdown whilst bidders buy houses online. Audio

node.title: Service set up to help start-up businesses
node.description: A trio of business leaders have set up an advisory service to help early-stage start-ups develop their businesses.

node.title: Solomons police overrun, Australia deploying support personnel
node.description: Police in Solomon Islands were overrun today as rioters and looters tore through the capital honiara.

node.title: More Than $90 Million Spent in New Jersey Governor's Race, State's Second Costliest
node.description: The number falls below the inflation-adjusted amount raised during the state's 2005's gubernatorial election.

node.title: Abuses Under Gambia’s Ex-Ruler Should Be Prosecuted, Inquiry Says
node.description: A commission’s long-awaited investigation reported widespread human rights violations, but it is not clear if anyone will be charged with crimes.
